metadata.header_path: /FORM 10-K/Part I/Item 1A - Risk Factors/Business and Industry Risks/
aws::graph::propositions: # Amazon's Foreign Exchange Risk Factors
Amazon has foreign exchange risk exposure in international operations.
Amazon's international stores' results of operations are exposed to foreign exchange rate fluctuations.
Amazon's product offerings are exposed to foreign exchange rate fluctuations.
Amazon's service offerings are exposed to foreign exchange rate fluctuations.
Amazon's certain intercompany balances are exposed to foreign exchange rate fluctuations.
Foreign exchange rate fluctuations may cause operating results to differ materially from expectations.
Amazon may record significant gains on the remeasurement of intercompany balances due to fluctuations.
Amazon may record significant losses on the remeasurement of intercompany balances due to fluctuations.
Amazon's exposure to exchange rate fluctuations has increased as Amazon has expanded international operations.
Amazon holds cash equivalents in foreign currencies.
Amazon holds marketable securities in foreign currencies.
Amazon holds cash equivalents and/or marketable securities in British Pounds.
Amazon holds cash equivalents and/or marketable securities in Canadian Dollars.
Amazon holds cash equivalents and/or marketable securities in Euros.
Amazon holds cash equivalents and/or marketable securities in Japanese Yen.
When the U.S. Dollar strengthens compared to these currencies, cash equivalents balances, when translated, may be materially less than expected.
When the U.S. Dollar strengthens compared to these currencies, marketable securities balances, when translated, may be materially less than expected.
When the U.S. Dollar weakens compared to these currencies, cash equivalents balances, when translated, may be materially more than expected.
When the U.S. Dollar weakens compared to these currencies, marketable securities balances, when translated, may be materially more than expected.

metadata.header_path: /FORM 10-K/Part I/Item 1A - Risk Factors/Business and Industry Risks/

text:
##### We Have Foreign Exchange Risk

The results of operations of, and certain of our intercompany balances associated with, our international stores and product and service offerings are exposed to foreign exchange rate fluctuations. Due to these fluctuations, operating results may differ materially from expectations, and we may record significant gains or losses on the remeasurement of intercompany balances. As we have expanded our international operations, our exposure to exchange rate fluctuations has increased. We also hold cash equivalents and/or marketable securities in foreign currencies such as British Pounds, Canadian Dollars, Euros, and Japanese Yen. When the U.S. Dollar strengthens compared to these currencies, cash equivalents, and marketable securities balances, when translated, may be materially less than expected and vice versa.
